title: Raheem Sterling replaces Thierry Henry as face of Gillette
text:
Raheem Sterling has been confirmed as the new face of Gillette, taking him another step closer to becoming English football's biggest commercial earner since David Beckham.

Telegraph Sport had disclosed in August how the 24-year-old was being courted by the shaving brand as a possible successor to Thierry Henry.

He is already set to appear in a Pepsi advertisement with Lionel Messi and Paul Pogba before next summer’s European championships and has been in advanced talks with Air Jordan over a new boot deal.

Gary Coombe, Gillette's chief executive, told the Leaders Sports Business Summit at Twickenham, how the Sterling would emulate the likes of Pele, Tiger Woods, Roger Federer and Henry by joining his brand.

“We have agreed a partnership with Raheem Sterling,” he said. “He is a great soccer player but the reason we were very keen to join up with Raheem was because he is doing wonderful work beyond the world of soccer.

“His stance on tackling racism is very congruent with our values and the sort of person we want to be associating ourselves with.”
description: Raheem Sterling has been confirmed as the new face of Gillette, taking him another step closer to becoming English football's biggest commercial earner since David Beckham.
